job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Casper, WY
pros: Teamwork and open communication encouraged. Awesome place to work.

pros: Wasn't ever asked for a kidney
cons: Was asked to do everything else

job_title: Certified Sterile Processing Tech in Casper, WY
pros: WMC is a very nice hospital, the employees care about patients and we make it a goal to make sure everyone is safe and gets the care they need.
cons: I don't really have any. The teamwork is great, the hospital cares about their employees.

review_title: Great place to get experience but not a forever job.
pros: Easy to get a job here right out of school to gain experience, they are a regional medical center in the middle of the state so you will get to see lots of advanced patient cases. Many hospitals send their ill patient here so you will see a little bit of everything. Lots of opportunities for advancement due to high turn over rate.  You can literally go anywhere if you stay long enough.
cons: This hospital is going through financial hardship so the staff benefits are continually being taken away to benefit the administration budget crisis.  Lots of staff members leave for better employment opportunities so there is hardly any senior staff left, leaving clinical departments very green in their knowledge.  Constantly understaffed so the patient to nurse ratio is too high to deliver quality care.

pros: Great staff to work with. Hard working team members that really care about their community.
cons:
Consistently understaffed and underpaid. High patient to RN ratios. The only breaks are typically the ones you manage for yourself.  
This hospital has adapted the culture of "we do it because it's the way we've always done it". This hospital needs a nurses union to represent and to help make effective change. These people are tired.

review_title: Like a family, who are all patient-oriented and passionate about their work.
pros: Great pay, great crew, different thing every day but your job is mostly defined so you at least know how to succeed.
cons: Whatever shift you are hired on as, you will most likely be stuck at because people do not leave this job. On the plus though, you know exactly what you are working a year from whenever, because your schedule is unchanging.

pros: I have nothing good to say except that if you have a different approach to doing your job, don't go there
cons: Can be fired without notice. Depends on who you cross and what action they take. They have a HR Dept that is more powerful than anywhere I've ever worked. They do nothing to protect their employees.

pros: Flexible schedule.  If you are unsure of something, a coworker is always willing to help.  Hospital is the perfect size that leaders and managers know you on a first name basis.
cons: At times you have go through several processes to get the final result.  Certain steps could be eliminated.

job_title: ER Tech in Casper Mountain, WY
pros: Loved going to work every day. The staff and doctors really got to know me as a person, not just an employee.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about working at Wyoming Medical Center at this time. I could have used a wage increase more often, but who couldn't use that!

review_title: It is a good job with great hours, but can become very monotonous.
job_title: Data Quality Analyst in Casper, WY
pros: Mon-Fri at a set 40 hrs. No shift work, weekends call or holidays.
cons: In the department I work in, there is no room for advancement at all.

review_title: Poor leadership and financial difficulties make this an opportunity to pass up
pros: Located centrally in Wyoming, Casper Wyoming is near many wonderful areas. Casper is also a exciting and vibrant outdoor activity area.
cons: Poor leadership tolerates harassment of its workers even after being reported and lackluster pay and benefits. Hospital is a hodgepodge of additions with a architectural layout that is discordant. It seems dark and gloomy.

job_title: Central Scheduling Specialist in Casper, WY
pros: Pay but benefits are so good just the hourly pay.
cons: Very strict on their clocking in and out policy depending on what department you work for or your who your supervisor is. Three strikes and your a goner.

review_title: A great small hospital with a large mission
pros: Lots of variety and autonomy.
cons: Financial challenges with current structure and market forces.

cons: Should be more flexible on working from home (where appropriate).
